abstract: Declares that a type can transmit a sequence of values over time.
overview:
## Overview

A publisher delivers elements to one or more [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber] instances. The subscriber’s [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/Input] and [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/Failure] associated types must match the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/Output] and [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/Failure] types declared by the publisher. The publisher implements the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/receive(subscriber:)]method to accept a subscriber.

After this, the publisher can call the following methods on the subscriber:

Every `Publisher` must adhere to this contract for downstream subscribers to function correctly.

### Using operators

Extensions on `Publisher` define a wide variety of *operators* that you compose to create sophisticated event-processing chains. Each operator returns a type that implements the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher] protocol Most of these types exist as extensions on the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers] enumeration. For example, the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/map(_:)-99evh] operator returns an instance of [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers/Map].

Use operators to assemble a chain of republishers, optionally ending with a subscriber, that processes elements produced by upstream publishers. Each operator creates and configures an instance of a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher] or [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber], and subscribes it to the publisher that you call the method on.

In the following example, a sequence publisher emits the integers 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. A [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/filter(_:)] operator creates a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers/Filter] publisher to only republish even values. A second operator creates a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscribers/Sink] subscriber to print out each value received. The sink subscriber automatically subscribes to the filter publisher, at which point the filter publisher subscribes to its upstream publisher, the sequence publisher.

## Creating Your Own Publishers

Rather than implementing the `Publisher` protocol yourself, you can create your own publisher by using one of several types provided by the Combine framework:
rawMarkdown:
---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Combine/Publisher
crawled: 2025-12-03T17:02:10Z
---

# Publisher

**Protocol**

Declares that a type can transmit a sequence of values over time.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol Publisher<Output, Failure>
```

## Overview

A publisher delivers elements to one or more [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber] instances. The subscriber’s [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/Input] and [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/Failure] associated types must match the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/Output] and [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/Failure] types declared by the publisher. The publisher implements the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/receive(subscriber:)]method to accept a subscriber.

After this, the publisher can call the following methods on the subscriber:

- [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/receive(subscription:)]: Acknowledges the subscribe request and returns a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscription] instance. The subscriber uses the subscription to demand elements from the publisher and can use it to cancel publishing.
- [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/receive(_:)]: Delivers one element from the publisher to the subscriber.
- [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber/receive(completion:)]: Informs the subscriber that publishing has ended, either normally or with an error.

Every `Publisher` must adhere to this contract for downstream subscribers to function correctly.



### Using operators

Extensions on `Publisher` define a wide variety of *operators* that you compose to create sophisticated event-processing chains. Each operator returns a type that implements the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher] protocol Most of these types exist as extensions on the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers] enumeration. For example, the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/map(_:)-99evh] operator returns an instance of [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers/Map].

Use operators to assemble a chain of republishers, optionally ending with a subscriber, that processes elements produced by upstream publishers. Each operator creates and configures an instance of a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher] or [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscriber], and subscribes it to the publisher that you call the method on.

In the following example, a sequence publisher emits the integers 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5. A [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/filter(_:)] operator creates a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publishers/Filter] publisher to only republish even values. A second operator creates a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscribers/Sink] subscriber to print out each value received. The sink subscriber automatically subscribes to the filter publisher, at which point the filter publisher subscribes to its upstream publisher, the sequence publisher.

```swift
let cancellable = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5].publisher
    .filter {
        $0 % 2 == 0
    }
    .sink {
        print ("Even number: \($0)")
    }
// Prints:
// Even number: 2
// Even number: 4
```

## Creating Your Own Publishers

Rather than implementing the `Publisher` protocol yourself, you can create your own publisher by using one of several types provided by the Combine framework:

- Use a concrete subclass of [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subject], such as [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/PassthroughSubject], to publish values on-demand by calling its [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subject/send(_:)] method.
- Use a [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/CurrentValueSubject] to publish whenever you update the subject’s underlying value.
- Add the `@Published` annotation to a property of one of your own types. In doing so, the property gains a publisher that emits an event whenever the property’s value changes. See the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Published] type for an example of this approach.

## Declaring supporting types

- **Output**: The kind of values published by this publisher.
- **Failure**: The kind of errors this publisher might publish.

## Working with subscribers

- **receive(subscriber:)**: Attaches the specified subscriber to this publisher.
- **subscribe(_:)**: Attaches the specified subscriber to this publisher.
- **subscribe(_:)**: Attaches the specified subject to this publisher.

## Mapping elements

- **map(_:)**: Transforms all elements from the upstream publisher with a provided closure.
- **tryMap(_:)**: Transforms all elements from the upstream publisher with a provided error-throwing closure.
- **mapError(_:)**: Converts any failure from the upstream publisher into a new error.
- **replaceNil(with:)**: Replaces nil elements in the stream with the provided element.
- **scan(_:_:)**: Transforms elements from the upstream publisher by providing the current element to a closure along with the last value returned by the closure.
- **tryScan(_:_:)**: Transforms elements from the upstream publisher by providing the current element to an error-throwing closure along with the last value returned by the closure.
- **setFailureType(to:)**: Changes the failure type declared by the upstream publisher.

## Filtering elements

- **filter(_:)**: Republishes all elements that match a provided closure.
- **tryFilter(_:)**: Republishes all elements that match a provided error-throwing closure.
- **compactMap(_:)**: Calls a closure with each received element and publishes any returned optional that has a value.
- **tryCompactMap(_:)**: Calls an error-throwing closure with each received element and publishes any returned optional that has a value.
- **removeDuplicates()**: Publishes only elements that don’t match the previous element.
- **removeDuplicates(by:)**: Publishes only elements that don’t match the previous element, as evaluated by a provided closure.
- **tryRemoveDuplicates(by:)**: Publishes only elements that don’t match the previous element, as evaluated by a provided error-throwing closure.
- **replaceEmpty(with:)**: Replaces an empty stream with the provided element.
- **replaceError(with:)**: Replaces any errors in the stream with the provided element.

## Reducing elements

- **collect()**: Collects all received elements, and emits a single array of the collection when the upstream publisher finishes.
- **collect(_:)**: Collects up to the specified number of elements, and then emits a single array of the collection.
- **collect(_:options:)**: Collects elements by a given time-grouping strategy, and emits a single array of the collection.
- **Publishers.TimeGroupingStrategy**: A strategy for collecting received elements.
- **ignoreOutput()**: Ignores all upstream elements, but passes along the upstream publisher’s completion state (finished or failed).
- **reduce(_:_:)**: Applies a closure that collects each element of a stream and publishes a final result upon completion.
- **tryReduce(_:_:)**: Applies an error-throwing closure that collects each element of a stream and publishes a final result upon completion.

## Applying mathematical operations on elements

- **count()**: Publishes the number of elements received from the upstream publisher.
- **max()**: Publishes the maximum value received from the upstream publisher, after it finishes.
- **max(by:)**: Publishes the maximum value received from the upstream publisher, using the provided ordering closure.
- **tryMax(by:)**: Publishes the maximum value received from the upstream publisher, using the provided error-throwing closure to order the items.
- **min()**: Publishes the minimum value received from the upstream publisher, after it finishes.
- **min(by:)**: Publishes the minimum value received from the upstream publisher, after it finishes.
- **tryMin(by:)**: Publishes the minimum value received from the upstream publisher, using the provided error-throwing closure to order the items.

## Applying matching criteria to elements

- **contains(_:)**: Publishes a Boolean value upon receiving an element equal to the argument.
- **contains(where:)**: Publishes a Boolean value upon receiving an element that satisfies the predicate closure.
- **tryContains(where:)**: Publishes a Boolean value upon receiving an element that satisfies the throwing predicate closure.
- **allSatisfy(_:)**: Publishes a single Boolean value that indicates whether all received elements pass a given predicate.
- **tryAllSatisfy(_:)**: Publishes a single Boolean value that indicates whether all received elements pass a given error-throwing predicate.

## Applying sequence operations to elements

- **drop(untilOutputFrom:)**: Ignores elements from the upstream publisher until it receives an element from a second publisher.
- **dropFirst(_:)**: Omits the specified number of elements before republishing subsequent elements.
- **drop(while:)**: Omits elements from the upstream publisher until a given closure returns false, before republishing all remaining elements.
- **tryDrop(while:)**: Omits elements from the upstream publisher until an error-throwing closure returns false, before republishing all remaining elements.
- **append(_:)**: Appends a publisher’s output with the specified elements.
- **append(_:)**: Appends a publisher’s output with the specified sequence.
- **append(_:)**: Appends the output of this publisher with the elements emitted by the given publisher.
- **prepend(_:)**: Prefixes a publisher’s output with the specified values.
- **prepend(_:)**: Prefixes a publisher’s output with the specified sequence.
- **prepend(_:)**: Prefixes the output of this publisher with the elements emitted by the given publisher.
- **prefix(_:)**: Republishes elements up to the specified maximum count.
- **prefix(while:)**: Republishes elements while a predicate closure indicates publishing should continue.
- **tryPrefix(while:)**: Republishes elements while an error-throwing predicate closure indicates publishing should continue.
- **prefix(untilOutputFrom:)**: Republishes elements until another publisher emits an element.

## Selecting specific elements

- **first()**: Publishes the first element of a stream, then finishes.
- **first(where:)**: Publishes the first element of a stream to satisfy a predicate closure, then finishes normally.
- **tryFirst(where:)**: Publishes the first element of a stream to satisfy a throwing predicate closure, then finishes normally.
- **last()**: Publishes the last element of a stream, after the stream finishes.
- **last(where:)**: Publishes the last element of a stream that satisfies a predicate closure, after upstream finishes.
- **tryLast(where:)**: Publishes the last element of a stream that satisfies an error-throwing predicate closure, after the stream finishes.
- **output(at:)**: Publishes a specific element, indicated by its index in the sequence of published elements.
- **output(in:)**: Publishes elements specified by their range in the sequence of published elements.

## Collecting and republishing the latest elements from multiple publishers

- **combineLatest(_:_:)**: Subscribes to an additional publisher and invokes a closure upon receiving output from either publisher.
- **combineLatest(_:)**: Subscribes to an additional publisher and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from either publisher.
- **combineLatest(_:_:_:)**: Subscribes to two additional publishers and invokes a closure upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
- **combineLatest(_:_:)**: Subscribes to two additional publishers and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
- **combineLatest(_:_:_:_:)**: Subscribes to three additional publishers and invokes a closure upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
- **combineLatest(_:_:_:)**: Subscribes to three additional publishers and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from any of the publishers.

## Republishing elements from multiple publishers as an interleaved stream

- **merge(with:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from another publisher of the same type, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from another publisher, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:_:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from two other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:_:_:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from three other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from four other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:_:_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from five other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:_:_:_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from six other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
- **merge(with:_:_:_:_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from this publisher with those from seven other publishers, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.

## Collecting and republishing the oldest unconsumed elements from multiple publishers

- **zip(_:)**: Combines elements from another publisher and deliver pairs of elements as tuples.
- **zip(_:_:)**: Combines elements from another publisher and delivers a transformed output.
- **zip(_:_:)**: Combines elements from two other publishers and delivers groups of elements as tuples.
- **zip(_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from two other publishers and delivers a transformed output.
- **zip(_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from three other publishers and delivers groups of elements as tuples.
- **zip(_:_:_:_:)**: Combines elements from three other publishers and delivers a transformed output.

## Republishing elements by subscribing to new publishers

- **flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)**: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
- **flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)**: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
- **flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)**: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
- **flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)**: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
- **switchToLatest()**: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
- **switchToLatest()**: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
- **switchToLatest()**: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
- **switchToLatest()**: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.

## Handling errors

- **assertNoFailure(_:file:line:)**: Raises a fatal error when its upstream publisher fails, and otherwise republishes all received input.
- **catch(_:)**: Handles errors from an upstream publisher by replacing it with another publisher.
- **tryCatch(_:)**: Handles errors from an upstream publisher by either replacing it with another publisher or throwing a new error.
- **retry(_:)**: Attempts to recreate a failed subscription with the upstream publisher up to the number of times you specify.

## Controlling timing

- **measureInterval(using:options:)**: Measures and emits the time interval between events received from an upstream publisher.
- **debounce(for:scheduler:options:)**: Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
- **delay(for:tolerance:scheduler:options:)**: Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time on a particular scheduler.
- **throttle(for:scheduler:latest:)**: Publishes either the most-recent or first element published by the upstream publisher in the specified time interval.
- **timeout(_:scheduler:options:customError:)**: Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.

## Encoding and decoding

- **encode(encoder:)**: Encodes the output from upstream using a specified encoder.
- **decode(type:decoder:)**: Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.

## Identifying properties with key paths

- **map(_:)**: Publishes the value of a key path.
- **map(_:_:)**: Publishes the values of two key paths as a tuple.
- **map(_:_:_:)**: Publishes the values of three key paths as a tuple.

## Working with multiple subscribers

- **multicast(_:)**: Applies a closure to create a subject that delivers elements to subscribers.
- **multicast(subject:)**: Provides a subject to deliver elements to multiple subscribers.
- **share()**: Shares the output of an upstream publisher with multiple subscribers.

## Buffering elements

- **buffer(size:prefetch:whenFull:)**: Buffers elements received from an upstream publisher.
- **Publishers.PrefetchStrategy**: A strategy for filling a buffer.
- **Publishers.BufferingStrategy**: A strategy that handles exhaustion of a buffer’s capacity.

## Performing type erasure

- **eraseToAnyPublisher()**: Wraps this publisher with a type eraser.

## Specifying schedulers

- **subscribe(on:options:)**: Specifies the scheduler on which to perform subscribe, cancel, and request operations.
- **receive(on:options:)**: Specifies the scheduler on which to receive elements from the publisher.

## Adding explicit connectability

- **makeConnectable()**: Creates a connectable wrapper around the publisher.

## Connecting simple subscribers

- **assign(to:on:)**: Assigns each element from a publisher to a property on an object.
- **assign(to:)**: Republishes elements received from a publisher, by assigning them to a property marked as a publisher.
- **sink(receiveCompletion:receiveValue:)**: Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior.
- **sink(receiveValue:)**: Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior to a publisher that never fails.

## Accessing elements asynchronously

- **values**: The elements produced by the publisher, as an asynchronous sequence.
- **values**: The elements produced by the publisher, as a throwing asynchronous sequence.

## Debugging

- **breakpoint(receiveSubscription:receiveOutput:receiveCompletion:)**: Raises a debugger signal when a provided closure needs to stop the process in the debugger.
- **breakpointOnError()**: Raises a debugger signal upon receiving a failure.
- **handleEvents(receiveSubscription:receiveOutput:receiveCompletion:receiveCancel:receiveRequest:)**: Performs the specified closures when publisher events occur.
- **print(_:to:)**: Prints log messages for all publishing events.

## Publishers

- **Publishers**: A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
- **AnyPublisher**: A publisher that performs type erasure by wrapping another publisher.
- **Published**: A type that publishes a property marked with an attribute.
- **Cancellable**: A protocol indicating that an activity or action supports cancellation.
- **AnyCancellable**: A type-erasing cancellable object that executes a provided closure when canceled.

## Inherited By

- ConnectablePublisher
- Subject

## Conforming Types

- AnyPublisher

items.name: combineLatest(_:_:)

items.description: Subscribes to an additional publisher and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from either publisher.
items.name: combineLatest(_:)

items.description: Subscribes to two additional publishers and invokes a closure upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
items.name: combineLatest(_:_:_:)

items.description: Subscribes to two additional publishers and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
items.name: combineLatest(_:_:)

items.description: Subscribes to three additional publishers and invokes a closure upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
items.name: combineLatest(_:_:_:_:)

items.description: Subscribes to three additional publishers and publishes a tuple upon receiving output from any of the publishers.
items.name: combineLatest(_:_:_:)

sections.title: Collecting and republishing the latest elements from multiple publishers

items.description: Combines elements from this publisher with those from another publisher of the same type, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.
items.name: merge(with:)

items.description: Combines elements from this publisher with those from another publisher, delivering an interleaved sequence of elements.

sections.title: Collecting and republishing the oldest unconsumed elements from multiple publishers

items.description: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
items.name: flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)

items.description: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
items.name: flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)

items.description: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
items.name: flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)

items.description: Transforms all elements from an upstream publisher into a new publisher up to a maximum number of publishers you specify.
items.name: flatMap(maxPublishers:_:)

items.description: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
items.name: switchToLatest()

items.description: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
items.name: switchToLatest()

items.description: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
items.name: switchToLatest()

items.description: Republishes elements sent by the most recently received publisher.
items.name: switchToLatest()

sections.title: Republishing elements by subscribing to new publishers

items.description: Raises a fatal error when its upstream publisher fails, and otherwise republishes all received input.
items.name: assertNoFailure(_:file:line:)

items.description: Handles errors from an upstream publisher by replacing it with another publisher.
items.name: catch(_:)

items.description: Handles errors from an upstream publisher by either replacing it with another publisher or throwing a new error.
items.name: tryCatch(_:)

items.description: Attempts to recreate a failed subscription with the upstream publisher up to the number of times you specify.
items.name: retry(_:)

items.description: Measures and emits the time interval between events received from an upstream publisher.
items.name: measureInterval(using:options:)

items.description: Publishes elements only after a specified time interval elapses between events.
items.name: debounce(for:scheduler:options:)

items.description: Delays delivery of all output to the downstream receiver by a specified amount of time on a particular scheduler.
items.name: delay(for:tolerance:scheduler:options:)

items.description: Publishes either the most-recent or first element published by the upstream publisher in the specified time interval.
items.name: throttle(for:scheduler:latest:)

items.description: Terminates publishing if the upstream publisher exceeds the specified time interval without producing an element.
items.name: timeout(_:scheduler:options:customError:)

items.description: Encodes the output from upstream using a specified encoder.
items.name: encode(encoder:)

items.description: Decodes the output from the upstream using a specified decoder.
items.name: decode(type:decoder:)

items.description: Publishes the value of a key path.
items.name: map(_:)

items.description: Publishes the values of two key paths as a tuple.
items.name: map(_:_:)

items.description: Publishes the values of three key paths as a tuple.
items.name: map(_:_:_:)

items.description: Applies a closure to create a subject that delivers elements to subscribers.
items.name: multicast(_:)

items.description: Provides a subject to deliver elements to multiple subscribers.
items.name: multicast(subject:)

items.description: Shares the output of an upstream publisher with multiple subscribers.
items.name: share()

items.description: Buffers elements received from an upstream publisher.
items.name: buffer(size:prefetch:whenFull:)

items.description: A strategy for filling a buffer.
items.name: Publishers.PrefetchStrategy

items.description: A strategy that handles exhaustion of a buffer’s capacity.
items.name: Publishers.BufferingStrategy

items.description: Wraps this publisher with a type eraser.
items.name: eraseToAnyPublisher()

items.description: Specifies the scheduler on which to perform subscribe, cancel, and request operations.
items.name: subscribe(on:options:)

items.description: Specifies the scheduler on which to receive elements from the publisher.
items.name: receive(on:options:)

items.description: Creates a connectable wrapper around the publisher.
items.name: makeConnectable()

items.description: Assigns each element from a publisher to a property on an object.
items.name: assign(to:on:)

items.description: Republishes elements received from a publisher, by assigning them to a property marked as a publisher.
items.name: assign(to:)

items.description: Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior.
items.name: sink(receiveCompletion:receiveValue:)

items.description: Attaches a subscriber with closure-based behavior to a publisher that never fails.
items.name: sink(receiveValue:)

items.description: The elements produced by the publisher, as an asynchronous sequence.
items.name: values

items.description: The elements produced by the publisher, as a throwing asynchronous sequence.
items.name: values

items.description: Raises a debugger signal when a provided closure needs to stop the process in the debugger.
items.name: breakpoint(receiveSubscription:receiveOutput:receiveCompletion:)

items.description: Raises a debugger signal upon receiving a failure.
items.name: breakpointOnError()

items.description: Performs the specified closures when publisher events occur.
items.name: handleEvents(receiveSubscription:receiveOutput:receiveCompletion:receiveCancel:receiveRequest:)

items.description: Prints log messages for all publishing events.
items.name: print(_:to:)

items.description: A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
items.name: Publishers

items.description: A publisher that performs type erasure by wrapping another publisher.
items.name: AnyPublisher

items.description: A type that publishes a property marked with an attribute.
items.name: Published

items.description: A protocol indicating that an activity or action supports cancellation.
items.name: Cancellable

items.description: A type-erasing cancellable object that executes a provided closure when canceled.
items.name: AnyCancellable
